Management of shock.
Delivery of infectious cases HIV positive PW
Management of PIH/Eclampsia
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask for how to secure airway and breathing, Loading and Maintenance dose of Magnesium sulphate , Administration of Hypertensive Drugs

checkpoint.name: Postpartum Haemorrhage
Management of Puerperal sepsis
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Diagnose puerperal sepsis based on clinical criteria: continuous fever for at least 24 hours or recurring within the first 10 days after delivery, increased pulse rate, increased respiration, offensive/foul smelling lochia, sub involution of the uterus, headache and general malaise, pelvic pain, pain, swelling and pus discharge from laceration or episiotomy or incision. Conduct appropriate lab. investigations, Prescribes IV fluids and broad spectrum antibiotics for seven days & advises perennial care

checkpoint.name: Management of Uterine Atony
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Vigorous Uterine massage, gives Oxytocin 20 IU in 500 ml of R/L 40 to 60 drops/minute (Continue to administer Oxytocin uptown maximum of 3 litres of solution with Oxytocin) If still bleeding perform bi manual uterine compression with palpation of femoral pulse

checkpoint.name: Management and follow up of PIH/Eclampsia \Pre Eclampsia
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Monitors BP in every case, and tests for proteinuria if BP is >140/90 mmHg 
If BP is 140/90 mmHg or more with proteinuria 2+ along with any two of the following danger signs: severe headache, blurring of vision, severe pain abdomen or reduced urine output, BP > 160/110 or more with proteinuria 3+; OR in cases of Eclampsiaadministers loading dose of Magnesium Sulphate (MgSO4) and refers/ calls for specialist attention; continues maintenance dose of MgSO4- 5 g of MgSO4 IM in alternate buttocks every four hours, for 24 hours after birth/last convulsion, whichever is later
If BP is >160/110 mmHg or more, give appropriate anti-hypertensive (Hydralazine/Methyl Dopa/ Nifedipine)

checkpoint.name: Management of Postpartum Haemorrhage
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Assessment of bleeding (PPH if >500 ml or > 1 pad soaked in 5 Minutes. IV Fluid, bladder catheterization, measurement of urine output, Administration of 20 IU of Oxytocin in 500 ml Normal Saline or RL at 40-60 drops per minute . Performs Bimanual Compression of Uterus

checkpoint.name: Ruptured Uterus
Management of Retained Placenta
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Administration of another dose of Oxytocin 20IU in 500 ml of RL at 40-60 drops/min an attempt to deliver placenta with repeat controlled cord traction. If this fails performs manual removal of Placenta

checkpoint.name: Management of Obstructed Labour
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Diagnose obstructed labour based on data registered from the partograph, Re-hydrate the patient to maintain normal plasma volume, check vitals, give broad spectrum antibiotics, perform bladder catheterization and take blood for Hb & grouping, Decide on the mode of delivery as per the condition of mother and the baby

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of Indications for referring patient for Surgical Intervention
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff how they identify slow progress of labour , How they interpret Partogram

checkpoint.name: pre operative care
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for Haemoglobin level is estimated , and arrangement of Blood, IV line established, Catheterization, Demonstration of Antacids

checkpoint.name: Proper selection of Anaesthesia
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check Both General and Spinal Anaesthesia Options are available. Ask for what are the criteria for using spinal and GA

checkpoint.name: Intraoperative care
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for measures taken to prevent Supine Hypotension (Use of pillow/Sandbag to tilt the uterus), Technique for Incision, Opening of Uterus, Delivery of Foetus and placenta, and closing of Uterine Incision

checkpoint.name: Post operative care
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Monitoring of vitals I/O charting, uterine contraction, bleeding

checkpoint.name: Care of Cord and Eyes
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Delayed Cord Clamping, Clamps & Cut the cords by sterile instruments within 1-3 minutes of Birth 
Clean baby's eyes with sterile cotton/Gauge

checkpoint.name: Care of Cord and Eyes
Kangaroo Mother Care
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Observe /Ask staff about the practice

checkpoint.name: APGAR Score
Vitamin K
Recording date and Time of Birth, Weight
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the records

checkpoint.name: Dried and put on mothers abdomen
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: With a clean towel from head to feet, discards the used towel and covers baby including head in a clean dry towel

checkpoint.name: Vitamin K for low birth weight
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Given to all new born (1.0 mg IM in > 1500 gms and 0.5 mg in < 1500 gms

checkpoint.name: New born Resuscitation

checkpoint.name: Uterine Massage
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: After placenta expulsion , Checks Placenta & Membranes for Completeness

checkpoint.name: Use of Uterotonic Drugs
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Administration of 10 IU of oxytocin IM with in 1 minute of Birth

checkpoint.name: Management of 1st stage of labour:
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check progress is recorded, Women is allowed to give birth in the position she wants , Check progress is recorded on partograph

checkpoint.name: Management of 2nd stage of labour:
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Allows the spontaneous delivery of head , gives Perineal support and assist in delivering baby. Check progress is recorded on partograph
